intro: Cordula barbata, commonly known as the barbed cordula, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cordula barbata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks.
